Saint Joseph's University |occupation = |years_active = |home_town = [[Drexel Hill, PA]] |salary = |networth = |height = |weight = |title = |term = |predecessor = |successor = |party = |opponents = |boards = |religion = |spouse = Pam |partner = |children = 2 |parents = |relations = |callsign = |awards = |signature = |website = [http://sports.espn.go.com/ncb/bracketology Bracketology with Joe Lunardi] |footnotes = |box_width = }} '''Joseph Lunardi''' is a college [[basketball]] analyst for [[ESPN]]. He was born in [[Philadelphia]], he is a graduate of [[Haverford High School]] in Pennsylvania, and is a [[Saint Joseph's University]] alumnus. Lunardi currently lives in [[Drexel Hill, Pennsylvania]]. He is best known for creating [[Bracketology]], which he calls the "art and science" of predicting the teams that will be selected in the annual [[NCAA]] Men's Basketball Tournament. He is well-known as the resident bracketologist for ESPN. In addition to his duties at ESPN, he is the Assistant Vice President of Marketing Communications at [[Saint Joseph's University]] and does color commentary for men's basketball for the [[Saint Joseph's Hawks]]. Lunardi correctly predicted all 65 teams to appear in the [[2008 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|2008 NCAA Tournament]],{{cite news | url=http://www.nytimes.com/2008/03/17/sports/ncaabasketball/17notebook.html | title=Big East Stands Tallest With 8 Bids | author=Evans, Thayer | date=March 17, 2008 | accessdate=2009-03-15 | work=The New York Times}} while correctly selecting 63 out the 65 teams in the [[2009 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|2009 field]] by placing both Creighton and St. Mary's incorrectly in his final bracket on March 15.http://insider.espn.go.com/ncb/insider/news/story?id=3981856&&appRedirect=http%3a%2f%2finsider.espn.go.com%2fncb%2finsider%2fnews%2fstory%3fid%3d3981856 Lunardi correctly selected 64 of the 65 teams in the [[2010 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|2010 NCAA Tournament]], believing that Illinois would receive the final at-large bid, while in reality, Florida did.http://espn.go.com/blog/collegebasketballnation/post/_/id/6992/bracket-winners-and-losers Lunardi's first bracket for ESPN received 250,000 hits in the first 90 minutes posted. His brackets sometimes receive millions of hits over the course of a season.{{cite news | url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/03/03/AR2007030300980_pf.html | title=Need for Information Is Creating a Bracket | author=Prisbell, Eric | date=March 4, 2007 | accessdate=2009-03-15 | work=The Washington Post}} Since then, he has been a fixture on ESPN's ''Bracketology'' program and on ''[[SportsCenter]]'', especially during the months of February and March in the run-up to the NCAA Tournament.http://sports.espn.go.com/ncb/bracketology One predecessor in "Bracketology," to Lunardi would be the creator of CollegeRPI.com, Jerry Palm. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Lunardi, Joe | ALTERNATIVE NAMES =the bracketologist | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lunardi, Joe}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Saint Joseph's University alumni]]
